Key Match Events: Tanner Bibee gave up a two-run homer in the third and a solo shot in the fourth inning.
Bibee ended his day having given up three runs in six innings with no walks and nine strikeouts.
Steven Kwan was scratched from the lineup due to back soreness.
Zack Littell tossed six scoreless innings without issuing a walk.
David Fry had a pinch-hit RBI double in the eighth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt commented on the Rays' pitching, stating, 'They know how to pitch, and they've kept us off balance.'
Vogt praised Bibee's performance, saying, 'He did his job tonight, and he battled through it.'
David Fry acknowledged the Rays' pitching, saying, 'Give them credit, they’ve pitched well the last couple of days and their bullpen's really good for a reason.'

Vogt reflected on the upcoming games, stating, 'We've got our work cut out for us the next two days, but we're going to do what we do every day, show up ready to play and go out and give it our best.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians' AL Central lead shrinks with their second straight loss to the Rays.
Kansas City sits just three games back of Cleveland in the American League Central with 14 games remaining in the regular season.
Cleveland’s bats were held to just four hits in the game.
